channel.title: Scotland on Matěj Hejda
channel.description: Recent content in Scotland on Matěj Hejda

item.title: The Murals of Glasgow (ultimate list)
item.description: There's couple of things that Glasgow is renowned for. Some of them are positive: it serves as the gateway to the Highlands, has a vibrant, thriving music scene and Glaswegians in general are very friendly people… oh, and apparently also is the the birthplace of tikka masala. On the other hand, it also has quite a reputation for being rough and dangerous, but from my own personal experience, that's almost completely rooted in the past, and today's Glasgow is definitely as safe as any other big city in Europe (perhaps except for few areas further from the centre).

item.title: Munro #4: Beinn Chabhair
item.description: Welcome to a very first post on this blog! This was posted on the symbolic day of 02/02/2020 - you can't represent the date using only two numerals very often, and as such, this felt like a perfect starting date for the webpage! Munro Bagging log, #4: Beinn Chabhair (from Inverarnan) This was the very first Munro-targeting hillwalk of 2020 and the first walk we went for together with my flatmate Gergely.
